definitions.definition: Any of a family of curves defined as the locus of points p , such that each p is on a line that passes through a given fixed point P and intersects a given curve, C , and the distance from p to the point of intersection with C is a specified constant (note that for nontrivial cases two such points p satisfy the criteria, and the resultant curve has two parts).

main_definition: ( mathematics , geometry ) Any of a family of curves defined as the locus of points p , such that each p is on a line that passes through a given fixed point P and intersects a given curve, C , and the distance from p to the point of intersection with C is a specified constant (note that for nontrivial cases two such points p satisfy the criteria, and the resultant curve has two parts).
secondary_definitions: ( geology ) A conchoidal fracture in rock.
